questions.question_text:
A project manager is appointed to manage an infrastructure project that spans across several countries, including different time zones within a subregion. It is likely that most of the project team members will never meet, but they will have to collaborate to ensure deliverables are met.

What should the project manager do to ensure good collaboration between the remote project team members?

choices.B: Create a social media group platform for the team to create a supportive environment.
choices.D: Plan a communication method and allow the project team members to virtually interact.
choices.C: Set the ground rules and identify a contingency plan in the risk register.
choices.A: Discuss the concerns with the project sponsor and modify the project charter to include more budget for interactions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Plan a communication method and allow the project team members to virtually interact

Selected Answer: D
Plan communication method

choices.D: Conducted routine meetings and identified team members who are under performing.
choices.A: Set up weekly status meetings to review team progress, prepared weekly status reports to track progress, and regularly escalated delays.
choices.C: Met with the team, allowed team members to make decisions about what to do, and established performance goals.
choices.B: Established daily standup meetings to track and report on team progress and escalated delays to stakeholders as they occurred.

Not everyone on the team has experience working in agile. The schedule has started slipping due to the unclear structure of the agile development approach.

What should the project manager have done to avoid this situation?

Selected Answer: C
To avoid the issue of schedule slippage in an agile development approach, the project manager should focus on empowering the team, establishing clear performance goals, and fostering a collaborative environment where the team can make decisions and continuously improve their processes. This approach aligns with agile principles and ensures that the team can effectively manage their work and deliver on project objectives.

While daily standup meetings are a part of agile practices, the focus should be on facilitating team collaboration and addressing impediments rather than just tracking and reporting. Escalating delays to stakeholders without empowering the team to resolve issues may not effectively address the root cause.

A project team working on a hybrid project is struggling to achieve customer satisfaction. The team states that the customer keeps changing their priorities. Meanwhile, the customer argues that the project team does not understand their needs.

What should the project manager do?

choices.B: Hire an external organization to audit the project and deliverables.
choices.C: Ask the product owner to explain the customer needs to the project team.
choices.A: Meet with the customer and the project team to understand the problem.
choices.D: Escalate to the project sponsor and request immediate intervention.

PM needs to meet both parties for agreeable conflict resolution

questions.question_text:
A project manager is working on a project to build a manufacturing complex. The project will run in three different phases: engineering, procurement, and construction. The procurement phase is in the initiation stage. The project sponsor wants to pursue the project phases as they have been planned, but also wants to accommodate and adjust to new data, input from the customer, and changes during the various phases as the project progresses.

How should the project manager approach this project?
An agile project manager is evaluating the method that will be used to display the value of the work performed to date. Which method will they select to display to the project stakeholder?

discussion.content: The best method to display the value of the work performed to date to stakeholders in an agile project would likely be Option B: Burnup Chart.

Selected Answer: B
The correct method for displaying the value of work performed to date to project stakeholders is:

B. Burnup Chart

Explanation:

A Burnup Chart is a visual representation that shows the progress of work completed (value delivered) over time against the total scope. It is commonly used in agile projects to provide stakeholders with a clear view of the work performed to date and how much work remains. It helps in tracking performance and evaluating if the project is on track to meet its goals.

Selected Answer: B
